corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Jake Green National Maritime Union Photographs

abstract.value: Jake Green was a member of the National Maritime Union (NMU). The collection contains ten photographs concerned with the NMu, including images of the union's national conventions and officials, as well as Baltimore local NMU officials and events.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.
Provenance unknown, most likely donated by Jake Green. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 1950.163 and NPA.1990.002.
<list><item>Doyle, Joe. "National Maritime Union," in <title render="italic">Encyclopedia of the American Left</title>(New York, Oxford, 1998, Oxford Press).</item></list>

The photographs in this collection are all concerned with the National Maritime Union of America. They include images of the union's national conventions and officials, as well as of Maryland NMU officials and events. Individuals pictured include African-American labor union leaders Revels Cayton of the International Longshoremen and Warehousemen's Union (ILWU), and Josh Lawrence, Hugh Mulzac, and Ferdinand Smith of the NMU, as well as NMU activists and officials Danny Boano, Bill McCarthy, Bill Penman, Stanley Postek, and Patrick B. Whalen. Events covered include the Fairfield, Maryland launching of the SS Frederick Douglas (1943), the first merchant marine ship captained by an African-American (Hugh Mulzac), with an integrated crew.

corpname.value: National Maritime Union of America -- |v Portraits

dsc.value: <c id="aspace_ref13" level="series"><did><unittitle>Container list</unittitle></did><c id="aspace_ref14" level="file"><did><unittitle>The following eight 8x10 b&w photographs: <lb/>- Top National Maritime Union Leaders (Unity Conference 3/30/46), L to R: Josh Lawrence, Ferdinand Smith (National Secretary), Revels Cayton (of International Longshoremen's and Warehouse Union) <lb/>- Credential Committee (Eddie Gordon, far left) <lb/>- 1947 NMU Credential Committee. (Eddie Gordon fourth from left, Stanley Postek, 2nd from right. <lb/>- Captain Mulzac and company officials.) <lb/>- Launching SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. <lb/>- Launching of SS Frederick Douglass, Fairfield, MD, May 22, 1943. (Center, 4th from the left, James Drury, NMU Port Agent, Baltimore, with company representative. Ferdinand Smith, captain? 3rd mate <lb/>- John.) <lb/>- Image of a mural (?) of a man crushing a Nazi U-boat and towing ships behind him. <lb/>- Men standing on a stage, holding up letters that spell out part of "Support President Roosevelt" with same mural of man crushing a Nazi u-boat in background</unittitle><unitdate normal="1943/1947" type="inclusive">1943-1947 , undated</unitdate><container id="aspace_975bf41b2e130d88a3cf95f216a7f76b" label="Mixed Materials" type="Folder">1</container></did></c><c id="aspace_ref15" level="file"><did><unittitle>Two oversized (11x 19) b&w photographs: panoramic group shots of the Fourth Biennial Convention of the National Maritime Union, New York City, July 6, 1943, and the of the Sixth Convention NMU, September 22, 1947, also in New York City. In these photographs the following individuals have been identified: Danny Boano, Bill Penman, Bill McCarthy, and Stanley Postek.</unittitle><unitdate>Jul 6, 1943 , Sep 22, 1947</unitdate><container id="aspace_fb52c89d95e1f603c41e03756af2ba11" label="Mixed Materials" type="Box">OS002</container><container parent="aspace_fb52c89d95e1f603c41e03756af2ba11" type="Folder">1</container></did></c></c>
